file_content.text: Kotal-De, speak of your battle at the ship construction site.
My commandos attempted to reach the shield generators.
May the Mystics see no shadows on you, outsider.
Now is our chance to strike at Jokull, their leader.
I have sent a strike team ahead. They will need your help.
Jokull retreated to his stronghold. He has taken some of our wounded with him.
What kind of defenses does it have? How many Gormak will be guarding it?
Tell me about the stronghold.
The strongest Gormak will guard the king with technology and monstrosities.
Are they hostages? Can Gormak even negotiate?
Why would he take prisoners?
We don't know. This has never happened before.
On my way.
My second, Kotal-De, will join your assault inside.
The explosion shook the ground. The Gormak surely know their ship will never fly.
Go carefully. I await your return.
Who is in command here? I need information on the Gormak's ship.
I've been sent to help out. Someone here want to fill me in on what's happening?
You're the commander here, aren't you? You're the man I need to see.
I am in command of this outpost. I can tell you of the ship.
My second-in-command led a strike force to the construction site. They could not breach its shields.
What stopped them? Too many Gormak? Automated defenses?
Why not?
Where are the shield generators located? How are they defended?
Tell me about these shields.
Good. This could be fun.
The Gormak were organized and waiting. Led by one they call their king, Jokull.
They were too many and too entrenched. We were forced to turn back.
Since when do Gormak plan defenses? They're brutes.
Organized Gormak? That's new.
Jokull has united them. This has never happened before.
How close is it to completion? What kind of weaponry does it have?
Tell me about the ship.
The ship is nearly finished. It will be capable of attacking Voss-Ka by air.
Let me deal with them.
The generators surround the ship. Many Gormak will defend them. Take these.
Once the shield is down, plant the charges on the ship. That will keep it from the stars.
I cannot speak now.
